intro: Meibomia venosa, commonly known as the warty meibomia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and rough, warty texture on its stems and leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Meibomia venosa is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid climates.
